review: I would give this no stars if I could!!  Especially since they have cockroaches at this particular restaurant.  I took my kids there for lunch and saw a cockroach crawling the wall close to my 4 yr old's head.  I snatched it from the wall with my napkin and called the waitress over and showed her.  I handed the napkin to her so she could throw it away and she said "uh uh" and left me still clutching the roach.  After some minutes she comes back with a "to go" container for me to put it in.  I pretty much lost my appetite and told her so.  She glares at me and then brings me my check and tosses it at me across the table and through clenched teeth says she hopes I have a better day.  Look lady, its not my fault the restaurant is infested with roaches!  You know the saying, where you see one, there are a hundred more you don't see.  I didn't let my kids finish their meal.  I scooted them right out of there!  We will NEVER be going back.
Consistant quality. Always nice service. I love the patio seating, great for dining with your dog!

I've been going to this place for a few years now. And I like the food and the staff, very friendly. When you eat there, the food is always fresh and looks really yummy which is very important to me. BUT!!!! whenever i would do a take out (which is usually a pound of french fries, ranch and campfire sause), the food is old, the fries is not crunchy on the outside and soft on the outside. It's completely dry. I have a feeling they take old, cold fries, throw it on the pan, warm it up in the oven to give it some color for like 5 min and box it... not cool! i get home and throw it all away... I've complained one to the waiter, the second time to the manager. Then, i stopped going there for like a year. And guess what!? i came back after a year, hoping they changed their attitudes and standards on take-out food... but NO! the fries was old and dry again... Sorry, guys! i'm not coming back...
HORRIBLE SERVICE!!!!!!  Includes hostess and server. Absolutely the worst. Food is definately not worth it

This is the first and last time I will ever step into this horrible place. I came here to support my daughters school fundraiser and got the worst service ever. So the hostess, Emily, asked us how many in our party and we said five, but she was like "huh". I couldnt beleive what i just heard even with the high noise level in there. At this point, I said to myself its just her. We decided to stay because my daughter saw some of her friends and their parents. When my family and I were shown to our table, my wife and I had a feeling that our hostess, Emily, had walked straight to the kitchen. Before we had a chance to take our seats, we decided to head out the door. From here who ever is reading this post I will leave it to your imagination what could have lead if we had stayed. I would like to mention that this is my first post to yelp about a restaurant and I wouldnt go all this trouble to make a review.

Came out to Simi for business, after a long morning of meetings we took a lunch break and since we were by the town center we opted for Red Robin (the other places looked a tad too upscale for a 45 min lunch break). And if I may say so... NEVER AGAIN! I have been to this chain in other cities before, nothing memorable one way or the other, but the one in the so called town center is dreadful. The food took forever (25 minutes+) and while the server was very polite (we knew it wash't his fault) the manager who came to our table to "apologize" (an older gentleman) acted as if we were the problem, not the kitchen. Yes, they were busy (it was around 12:30), but that is really no excuse for an establishment that clearly has dealt with a rush before. In a world where chintzy burger joints abound, skip this one altogether. California Pizza Kitchen is right next door and I would take that (with a wait) any day over Simi Valleys Red Robin. Thumbs DOWN!

I pretty much hate everything I eat here except for the garlic fries - ask for them extra crispy and the freckled lemonade that has giant chunks of strawberries in it.  Those 2 things on the menu are amazing.  The burgers are ok for an average burger place.  I also really love how friendly the staff is here and it's nice that kids get balloons to entertain them.

Well in all fairness I was not expecting to be wow'd by the food here. But by the end of my dinner I was pretty impressed. Came on a Saturday night with the wife, our 2 nieces and nephew. We let them choose where to eat dinner and obviously we end up here. Was excpecting a long wait but to my suprise, we were seated right away. Looking through the menu my mouth starts watering as I read the descriptions fo the burgers. Hopefully they taste as good as they are described I say in my mind. I end up going with the chophouse burger. It comes with horseradish-sautéed mushrooms, steak sauce, Provolone cheese and crispy onion straws. It tasted as if they had taken their time cooking and assemling it. Extremely flavorful. The meat was tender and juicy, just as it should be. Plus it comes with bottomless fries so that does not hurt.  There is a full bar as well.  Had to deduct a star since our waitress hardly came to check on us. We had no drinks for at least 20 minutes. It was a slow night so there is no excuse. Other than that it was all good! To get back at our waitress we faked our neice's birthday and got a free desert! Ok c'mon, like you haven't done that before.

My 3 stars are for the food only, DELICIOUS!  Unfortunately, the service is lacking. It ALWAYS seems like there are never enough staff (even if isn't busy) for the amount of tables.  Although they are all very nice, that doesnt make up for my food being brought to me cold.   I'll go back but don't come  here if you are in a hurry or super hungry because your definantly going to have to wait.

I'd give this restaurant no stars if it would let me!  Where do I start?  I have been to many Red Robins in the past, both locally and other cities.  Its what you'd expect.  Not great, but not usually too bad, kids usually love it because of the balloons and big desserts.  In the past year or two, I have noticed some pretty significant cuts and to some extent of course it makes sense for a business to do what's necessary to ensure they stay afloat.  From what I can tell, how they have trimmed their expenses include no more balloons at all, 1 mini crayon instead of the little crayon box that came with the kids menu.  Now you get like 5 fries in your basket and are expected to ask constantly for more to fill up your plate.   But with all these cuts what has really driven me to want to scream to the rooftops is they have decided that one waiter can sufficiently handle all the tables in the restaurant during the lunch rush hour.  If this had happened to me once, I would say it was unfortunate scheduling but since my daughter has a class near this location at the Simi Town Center I have experienced the exact scenario twice a week apart.    During today's visit my husband and I (with our other baby) decided to give this place another try since its an easy atmosphere with kids.  After we were seated the host asked for our drinks and then the visit went downhill for that.  We had to work to get the very basics like a refill, utensils and napkins.  We put in our order and waited, waited, and waited over 40 minutes for 2 burgers and a kids meal.  And the waiter was never coming.  Instead the host guy was running around picking up all the slack and trying to help where possible.   This visit was extremely frustrating and by the time the food arrived we just wanted to get the check and leave. Oh yeah and the food was cold, bland and tasted like it was sitting under the heat lamps for 40 minutes. NEVER AGAIN!!!!

Premade bread, average burgers, stupid staff, they will make you wait, while there are open tables, dirty tables not cleaned waiter and greeter sitting on there but, just waiting,... - just bad food and service :)
The manager was very friendly and checked in on us. The server was great, good with the kids. Food was YUMM! Definitely a family A++ restaurant.

The food here is ok, just ok, but the service is horrible! I dined here with my husband, daughter, and 2 young sons on Wednesday and waited at least a half hour before my server, a tall thin guy, greeted us. We waited another 15 minutes before our drinks arrived (5 waters, a lemonade, and an iced tea). When he finally emerged from the kitchen with these, he paraded them around the restaurant for a few minutes before stopping to converse at the table behind us and THEN he gave us our drinks. I ordered an onion soup to start off with but it seems he forgot it. When I asked about it, he FINALLY brought it over and seconds later, our food arrived, which had been sitting in  the window for about 10 minutes. The ranch we asked for never made it over so another server brought it. THE WORST part of all this was that he didn't even know how to hold a glass. I had to ask for a new glass for my daughter since he had grabbed hers around the rim...ewwww! Oh, and no aplogogies there! One burger, one soup, one salad, and two kids meals took 2 hours...on a school night! I will have a real hard time going back but if I do I will remember to ask for the girl with the long straight black hair (I think her name was Gina). Management needs to get a handle on things here...SERVER 101: don't touch the rim of the glass! And don't make families with kids wait 30 minutes before even greeting them! FAIL!!!!!!!

Day visited: November 25th, 2012 Time visited: around 1:30pm ~ 3:30pm I like Red Robins, I really do but this one is the worst piece of shit of a chain ever. Flat sodas? CHECK. Dry burger buns? CHECK. Slow service? CHECK. Unhelpful hostess? CHECK. Waiting for a life time for a to-go box and check? CHECK. We visited here for a late lunch and sat down and ordered our drinks. Tick, tick, tick, tick... 10 minutes go by and still no drinks. Now there aren't that many people seated but I guess they have way too many tables being waited on one server. Finally we get our drinks and order our food. We ask for fries and it comes 5 minutes later. Tick, tick, tick, tick, tick... 20 minutes pass, food is running late and fries and drinks are long gone. 10 more minutes pass and FINALLY our mediocre food arrives. It was okay, nothing great but nothing too terrible to the point where I get food poisoning. We ask for drinks and again tick, tick, tick, tick, tick, tick... By the time our drinks came we were almost done so we asked for the check. TICK, TICK, TICK, TICK, TICK, TICK, TICK, MOTHA EFFING TICK... I ask one of the hostess if she could grab me a box for my sons food and she gave me the nastiest looks ever. B*tch it's not my fault your life sucks and you have to work at Red Robins but there are tons of other poor college students that can replace you.  15 minutes pass and we finally get the check and still no box so I ask our waiter to grab one... TICK, TICK, TICK, TICK, TICK, TICK, TICK, TICK, TICK, TICK, TICK, TICK. 20 minutes pass and the waiter comes back for the check but no box so I ask again... 3:30 rolls around and I still have not received my to go box so we decided it's not worth it and just as we were leaving the waiter comes with a box. I'm so fed up at that point I don't even want to box the food anymore. For waiters, waitresses that are working for tips THEY DO NOT DESERVE A SINGLE DIME. I have seen better service at a McDonalds than this shit hole.

The manager called and gave me a full refund for our meal. I'm hesitantly willing to maybe consider thinking about giving some thought to possibly coming back for a second go around. She was very nice and didn't try to make excuses. I appreciate her attitude towards the incident.

The food here is at best...NOT GOOD.  The management is horrible.  I say that because the service is and that's always a reflection on the management.  We unfortunately go there quite a bit because it's easy with kids after a sporting or school event and it's getting consistently worse.  We've been in on weekends and during the week and I've noticed the crowd has decreased quite a bit.  Each time I say I'm never coming back, but like an idiot I do. They are notorious for making use of their food lamps.  We're a family of four and every single time we see our food sitting under the lamps for an average of ten minutes while waiting for the rest of the order to be finished.  Sad thing is we're only talking salads and burgers...nothing complex.  Don't expect anything to be served hot here.  It's just not part of their business model.  They have the lamps so they use them.  Warm is about the best you're gonna get. Corporate management really needs to step in and re-train these managers as well as the staff.  There are so many good family restaurants out there that they can learn from.  I hope they read these reviews as they really need to do something.  It's quite embarrassing on their part.

I like this Red Robin.  They're always friendly, food always comes on time & the most important thing is that the food is fresh.  I have never had a bad experience here.  Just hope it doesn't shut down like the rest of the mall
We love the Burnin Love burger with the Veggie Patty. The service was great here and the wait time was only 10 mins (as they indicated).

Im so bummed that our pick up order experiences have been so bad lately. Just a forewarning, they no longer have a place for you to pick up your order, other than the front of the restaurant which means you are trying to pay and deal with the person also welcoming and seating people. Expect a nice long wait, only to go home to semi-warm food.  This has happened to us several times now so I guess we will only have to eat here when we can eat in. Dining in usually is a pretty good experience and we love their burgers and especially their fries. Red Robin seriously has some of the best dipping sauces!

I've been to several Red Robins in SoCal, it's a great place to go if you don't feel like gambling. As with most chains, it's super consistent, but the Simi Valley location, as compared to most lower end locals, has an emphasis on service and quality. What can I say that many other people haven't already? Good food, service, if something is wrong they will fix it, if you don't like something they'll replace it.
Not bad. It's a chain restaurant  so the entrees arnt outstanding. But the apps and beer are worth it. Also try the special seasoning.

I just went to the Red Robin website to look up what was in this salad I ordered, and apparently people tweet the page for Red Robin's Whiskey River® BBQ Chicken Salad?  Who are you guys?  Are you all okay? I hadn't been to a Red Robin since I was a teenager, but when we needed a place to eat in Simi Valley, our imaginations kind of flagged.  We found ourselves sipping sodas in a booth surrounded by walls of kitsch that were meant to look quirky and eclectic.  The overall effect was 100% chain restaurant chic. Service was decent and the meal was quick.  I had the aforementioned Whiskey River® BBQ Chicken Salad, which came with grilled chicken breast, avocado, and crispy onion over a mix of lettuce, corn, jicama, black beans, diced tomatoes, cheddar cheese, and tortilla strips.  I omitted the ranch but kept the BBQ sauce.  The salad was pretty lackluster, but no worse than expected.  I ate the chicken with a lot of the BBQ sauce, and picked at the rest. It might be a while until my next Red Robin meal, and I'm okay with that.  This was a strictly practical lunch, and I usually stay home for those.  Still, it wasn't bad, and it certainly served its purpose.  I'm sure it's a handy spot for a quick meal in Simi Valley.

I hope the managers and corporate read these things.  This particular Red Robin (Simi Valley, CA) is getting progressively worse with service.  Nothing is made from scratch.  It's all pre-prepared.  All they do is heat up the food, so it's hard to be non-consistent with food quality in that type of environment.  Don't get me wrong, the quality is not great, but at least that's consistent and you know what you get.  This is exactly why it's critical for them to have great service. Went there for lunch this week at a non peak time (2:00).  Service was HORRIBLE.  Server, Emily, couldn't crack a smile if she had to and doesn't grasp the concept of bottomless fries and free refills.  Not one refill.  Onion straws had more grease than a bicycle chain.  Didn't do anything about it.  They serve the food to the table all at once, but make no mistake...they don't prepare the food all at the same time.  We timed how long it took them to serve one of the burgers that had been sitting up there under the lamp.  14 minutes from the time the "preparer" placed it under the lamp til the time the server put it on the tray with three other entrees.  All the while the manager is nowhere to be found.  Four servers standing around laughing while the food is under the lamp, one of which has been sitting there for 14 minutes!  See pic on instagram under #poorservice.   Then the manager finally comes out and does nothing, but participate in the humorous conversation being had.  Doesn't lift one finger to help, coach or delegate. Corporate needs to evaluate their onsite leadership and decide if they want to continue to slide down hill in service and have a Denny's type reputation or pick it up and become one of the better family friendly restaurants.  When your business model calls for pre-prepared food there's not much you can do about quality and that's why service becomes key.  Service sets you apart from the other low quality family restaurants. You chains should really take a piece out of the Cheesecake Factory playback.  I don't think you hear too many complaints about their food quality and their service.  In fact, most people rave about. Learn a lesson!

This is one of my top 5 favorite restaurants. The food is great. Love the atmosphere. Staff is cool and fast. Its just a great place to eat. One of my favorite meals is the clucks and fries and the mint brownie shake is AMAZING! Lve eating here! :)

I recently wrote a complaint after having a bad experience at this location.  I want to send an update to let everyone know that Red Robin went out of their way to find out what happened and make things right with us.  I am VERY happy with the customer service here.  The owner and managers listen.  We will continue to go here weekly.  Money well spent.  Thank you.
A little pricey, but it seems everywhere we go lately is. Server Olivia is awesome! Turkey burger is one of the best around, well seasoned & very tasty.

I've been here a few times with family and friends. I mean burger wise, the burgers are pretty basic nothing special to them. But the fries with their special seasoning are on point ! Endless fries are pretty awesome. The onion ring stacks are pretty delicious and fun to eat. I recommend the onion rings and strawberry lemonade. Other then that l, I wasn't amazed with their burgers. Service was okay.
I have to say the dining room was 1/2 empty and there was still a 15 minute wait. When we asked the host, we were told there is not enough servers. Talk about bad service.

The only thing saving red robin from a one-star review here is their French fries. But in order to get some, I had to wait for 5 minutes to be seated (I was by myself, it was 3:30, NO one there, no excuse to not have a hostess at the front) and I was ultimately seated by a waitress who didn't care how long I waited by myself trying to get someone's attention.  I ordered fries and a coke. The coke came in a dirty glass, but no one came around again until I got my check so I could say something about it (let me say again: there were NO other patrons! And why am I left to wait?!). And to top it off, I guess fries aren't bottomless unless you get a 2000 calorie burger side. Well, I paid my 5 dollars for dirty coke and six French fries even though I felt ripped off on my 30 min lunch break.  This is not to mention the week before, I tried to get some delicious fries and I didn't have the patience to wait for the hostess to come back from... from... what? A manicure? Why is there NEVER a hostess to seat me?  Just go to CPK. They're much nicer and always have a hostess to greet you.

We went there last night with my wife and two kids. We ordered right away, since the kids were really hungry. We ordered two rootbeer floats, one of their burgers, kids meal and their marinara pasta.  Our water came so faaaassst...... Then that's it. After 15 minutes, they served the kid's meal and my burger with like 10 pieces of french fries. YES 10 (or maybe 9!), while waiting for my wife's pasta, I finished eating the fries already and my kids were done drinking their rootbeer floats (in a small kiddie glass cup). Fast forward about 10 minutes, the marinara chicken came, but without the toast bread. So we told the waitress about it and also I told her about my bottomless fries and two root beer floats, she said "got it" without asking if we need anything else. Fifteen minutes later, we were almost done eating and guess what? still awaiting for the fries and rootbeer, and I started wondering if I really ordered the bottomless fries??? I asked front-lady as she passes by and she told me a scripted-like response, like she saw the bartender busy that's why the floats aren't ready yet. WTH! do you really need a bartender for 2 glasses kid's floats? Well, they served the root beer floats right away, but HALF way full and another 10 (I think 9) pieces of cold fries! I told my wife, we not coming back to this place even it is FREE!!! I might understand the delay if the place was busy, but it wasn't, it was an ordinary Wednesday night with less than half full of customers.  It's sad as I like their burgers, but compared to those cheaper alternatives like Habit and In n out burgers (even Mc Donalds) here in Simi, the service is way better.

Went there today and must agree with the majority of posters here...this place sucks.  Went in around lunchtime at 12:30 and sat at the bar since I was alone.  The bartender finally walks up to his register a good 10 feet away and yells at me what I want.  Seriously, he couldn't extend the courtesy of actually walking up to me.  I have to yell back across another patron my order of a Whiskey Chicken Salad.  He also yelled at the other patron (who was 5 feet closer) what he wanted.  The other patron's order came about 15 minutes later.  I sat there patiently being totally ignored, the bartender never came back to inquire if I wanted another drink or to explain the long wait.  After 40 MINUTES I went to the front desk to ask to speak to a manager.  The woman at the front was conversing with the hostess, definitely not paying attention to her "wait staff".  When I told her I had a complaint about my long wait she immediately went to the kitchen and I was served about 5 minutes later with a soggy salad that had probably been sitting in dressing for at least 20 minutes.  They COMPED the meal.  Big deal, I don't go out to restaurants looking for free food, I go because I believe the food and service might be good.  The bartender only offered a cursory apology.  I think Mr. Stephen Carley ought to to look at this place and their horrible service.  I know that one bad apple doesn't spoil the entire bunch, but there are a LOT of negative reviews here for a reason.  I agree with the previous poster...go to the pizza kitchen across the sidewalk.  That place had great food and great service.  I will never patronize Red Robin again.

One of my favorite Red Robin's.  Every time I came here, I was greeted and treated well by attentive employees.  My drink was never empty.  The food was fast, and hot.  My favorite is the Blue Ribbon Burger.  I just can't stop eating that This is right in the mall, so depending on what day you go, parking can be a little packed.  But it's Simi, so it's not terrible.

Always a good experience.The wait staff is friendly and even remembers you , if you are like us and go all the time. Food is always fresh and the freckled lemonade is amazing. A must try restaurant if you have never tried it before.

Went here about a week and a half ago with wifey and I had the burger with the straw onions. Can't remember the name. Anyway, I asked for well-done fries at the beginning. So, the burgers arrive. The fries I got were normal (and not too warm). Waitress apologized. Fifteen minutes later she said the cook had a way of not cooking the fries well done because he had to send out the regular fries. Did not make sense to me. Ended up saying, that does not matter, there is something wrong in the operations. Her trying to rationalize made things worse. Later the manager comes and I express my disappointment why I could not get crispy or well-done fries when I order it at the outset. To remedy this, he offered to comp me that burger hoping I would give them another try in the future. Sure. Burger I had was OK, but just OK. I am, however, happy the manager did something about it. So, we came back on Memorial Day, not long after the original visit (in fact just 8 days apart). This time we both ordered the Mushroom Burger. I liked the flavor and savory taste of the burger, so did wifey. Fries ordered well done came as ordered without a fuss. Excellent effort and recovery. 4 stars. BTW, the Dijon mustard they give you is Grey Poupon, but the one with bits of brown flecks, like a "country style" Dijon, not the plain but creamy and delicate original.

Yum!! Holy knights of the round table!  I freaking love this joint! The vibe is great and the food.. the FOOD is amazing! Our waitresses were fabulously friendly and very attentive! This is definitely my friend and I's go to place. Shes glutten free so this place is great!

Went tonight with a friend.   Had a 5 min wait.  The waitress was very friendly and had really good customer service skills. The crispy chicken sandwich was really good and the fries were done how I like them. Very pleased with the Simi Valley location

Wow that waitress Ashley is wonderful as much as she is beautiful!! She knows her beer and made my family extremely happy even though she was apparently in training at the time.  Definitely sit in her section when you get there!

I have been here many times, with similar results during all those times. The food is always tasty, and arrives quickly. The staff is generally pretty nice. And those bottomless fries... yummy! I don't know why people complain that they "only" get 8-10 fries with their order. Well duh, they're huge steak fries! And you can get more for free.  They have a nice variety of American food: burgers, wraps, salads, sandwiches, milkshakes, etc. I also enjoy that they have seasonal items (such as oktoberfest or winter-themed milkshakes and food). Sometimes they'll give you a free sample of a new milkshake or item (one time got free shots!). Prices are typical, $8-$12 for your meal, and a little more for certain themed foods.  So why only 3 stars? No more happy hour : ( First, they downsized their portions, then they raised the price of appetizers and got rid of some of the good ones, then they got rid of happy hour altogether. That's a bummer because that was the best part of the restaurant. I will visit much less now that happy hour is gone (and don't try to tell me that their "new always low price" menu compensates for happy hour. It does not). I seriously used to go once a week and now I haven't been since they got rid of happy hour about 2 months ago. I'm in no rush to go back and pay full price for my drinks...  There was one time also where I told the waitress to keep the change and she brought it back, saying "that's all that was left". I think she was trying to say that we should have given a better tip. Dear waitresses: don't EVER ask for a bigger tip for just doing your job normally. That was at least 15%. Go above and beyond if you want 25%. It was very awkward and off-putting for us.   It also stinks that I have the royalty card yet have never been able to use it because I either didn't get a burger or someone else in my party wanted to use theirs. I think it should function more on a points system, point-per-dollar. It's not fair to only give points for one burger per check.

Always nicely greeted, so far I have no complaints about the food or staff. Food always comes as ordered, warm and hot.  Last visited ordered the Wedge Salad for $3.00, nice price for what you are served.  Staff has always been friendly.   Will keep coming back.

I am a fan of Red Robin. It is a good place to come with a family. If you sign up for their red robin club you receive a free meal on your birthday and when you purchase 9 entrees your 10th one is free. They have good fries, refills given, good wraps and chicken sandwiches. Service is friendly and the meal comes out pretty quickly.

This place was empty, and the employees made sure to not change the atmosphere. Service was lacking and the waiter was very apathetic. This place definitely needs a revival. If you work here and are reading this, get your restaurant together!

the burgers are nothing spectacular. honestly you can drive to thousand oaks, go to cheesecake factory, and pay 13 for the most amazing burger ever, with great service. red robin is where burgers go to die. seriously.

I walked in here with my wife and I was on crutches.  The hostess saw I was on crutches and tried seating us in the back and I was annoyed because I was on crutches. HELLO!!! There were plenty of open seats and I have no idea why she would seat me in the back knowing it was tough for one to get around on crutches.  We had to ask if we could sit in the booth that was closer and the hostess said, "sure" with an attitude. We were greeted by our server and we ordered our food and asked for 2 glasses of water and it took her 5 minutes or so for our water.  It wasn't even a busy day-we came on a Tuesday during lunch time.  We ended up flagging another server for our water and he kept apologizing on our servers behalf.  Unfortunately his apologies wasn't enough to want to me to come back.  I will sure miss the Royal burger but not enough for crappy service.

Red Robin's has the best burgers and shake that you will find anywhere. The variety of burgers they have is great, there is one for everyone. The shakes that they have, alcoholic and non-alcoholic and great as well. The bottomless steakfries are the best too.

Love this place!  Clean, modern restaurant located in the Simi Valley Town Center Mall. Hadn't been there in awhile so ventured over for dinner (on our way to the ever beloved Apple Store). Our waitress, Danielle, was fantastic.  Perfect mix of attention and being left alone.  Drinks refilled quickly.  Orders all correct.  Polite, efficient and thoughtful.  A+ If you like chips as an appetizer I'd suggest the chili/queso dip with them.  I was really surprised how good it was.  (Don't judge its looks when you first get it.. it doesn't look sexy but it's super tasty.) I had the Royal (a burger when an egg on top).  Of course it's not for everyone, but man I love me some burger/egg/bacon!  All our food was well prepared and good. Enjoyable dinner!

Guinness milk shake royal burger ,a1 burger Mac n cheese it was all really good full with flavor the shake was awesome very good service n they were fast on bringing out the food really good I completely recommended

I'm always super impressed with my food at Red Robin, but my last visit really disappointed me. The customer service was terrible, my French fries were soggy, and when we asked for seasoning salt she brought us a tiny container with a pinch of salt. Not very happy ):

My least favorite location. The food is good but the service is almost always bad. You wait forever for drinks & to have your order taken & even longer to get refills. Sometimes they don't even ask if you want a refill then charge you for it. Ugh. Some days the waiter/waitress is nice, but it's still slow as hell. The hostess has always been nice. Place gets pretty busy, but you can usually find a table. The fries and onion rings are really good. Sometimes they cook your burger wrong. Not sure how that's possible. Located in the mall.

She presented my salad  with a fingernail laying on the rim- and it was big- like it had popped off somebody's finger that was trying to win the Guinness Book of World Records.  So when I agreed to go a second time I was already set to be biased. The food I chose this time was a chicken cranberry almond salad with dressing on the side.  Chicken like the Rocky Mountains hard- I mean like Mc Donald's chicken nuggets that's been laying on the floor of your car.  I wish it was good.  We need a good place.

I love their burgers and bottomless fries. They have a burger, or chicken sandwich for everyone. BBQ, guacamole, or something new like the smoke and pepper burger, which I thoroughly enjoyed. I also love their clucks & fries dish. Just be sure to enjoy their "campfire sauce," which is so good that it would taste good on dirt. Love it!!
Good food, competent staff, and bottomless fries. I usually get the BBQ ranch chicken wrap. This chain does it right.

What the hell happened to Red Robin?! It's been a while since I've been here, but this used to be my go to spot to get a burger. I won't be coming back here. Ever. The hostesses in the front were extremely friendly but that didn't make up for the horrible service from our waiter. I came here on New Year's Eve around 5 and they didn't close until 7 P.M. which was more than enough time to get a quick bite and leave. Our server (who shall remain nameless) was extremely strange. We get that it was New Year's Eve and he probably wanted to leave, but still.. We got there 2 whole hours before they stopped seating people. He made it seem like he didn't want us there and when he talked to us, it sounded as if he was reading off a script. So awkward. Anyways, I love Freckled Lemonade and I think that Red Robin has one of the best, so I ordered that and the Red Robin Gourmet Cheeseburger while my boyfriend ordered the Clucks and Fries. First of all, what happened to their portions? Although the burger was still the same size, the clucks and fries only had 2 pieces of chicken and 3 pieces of baby shrimp along with a pathetic, tiny pile of fries underneath it. I understand that the fries are bottomless so you're able to order more whenever you please. We WOULD have ordered more if our waiter ever came to check up on us, but he never did. I would see him eying our table and walk the opposite direction or look away. By the time we finally got his attention, we weren't even in the mood to eat anymore. He didn't even refill my drink until I was practically waving my hands in the air. Even then, he got my drink order wrong and just gave me plain lemonade.  The prices have gone up and the portions have gotten so much smaller. Overall, I feel like I'm being generous giving them 2 stars, but the hostesses in the front are the only reason why I'm giving this location two stars.

Flat-average and overpriced considering how much delicious competition is in the area. They're not particularly bad, but there's nothing that makes them stand out in a sea of fantastic alternatives within five minutes.  My main gripe is that they tend to be slow, seemingly regardless of how many people are eating and serving. A couple of the more recent (and final) trips with my buddies have resulted in a long wait time *and* cold food. The timing is off or they don't care or something. Basically, there's not much else to say. It's a slow, average-tasting Red Robin's situated close to a million better alternatives.

I frequently eat at this Red Robin with my family and every time I come by and eat they're all friendly and fast at taking our orders and getting our food. I've never out of the 10+ times that I have been here had an issue or complaint. I recommend checking out this Red Robin. The only reason I'm giving it a 4/5 stars is because I found another one that is even more friendlier and quicker than this location.

I was very dissapointed. The greeter was trying to be funny I think by making weird observations.  Once seated wayyyyyy in the corner away from the main area (because I had a sleeping toddler in a stroller I guess ) we were promptly forgotten. They do not have sugars or sweet n low on the table so once I got my tea and noticed that, I had to wait 15 minutes to get some. They got my son's burger wrong twice and I was done eating by the time it came out right on the 3rd try. She may have got it right on the second but as I was explaining the simple thing he wanted she literally cut me off to yell at her boss that they were killing the servers and could he just wait 5 minutes?? Actually 3rd try was not right but we picked the onion ring off.  We were all alone in this huge back section so i just got to stare at the glare highlighting all of the filthy walls and pictures that are within arms reach of toddlers sticky hands. Gross. I have a toddler and i get it but they should really wipe that up once in a while.   I apologized to my son and said " next time we will go to Carl's Jr. " The burger was lackluster, just a tiny bit of fries and no one around to give you more because they are endless. So is the wait though. Hope your patience is endless if you try it!

We hadn't been to Red Robin in years and were looking for a place to grab a bite last night. We were thinking of CPK but decided to try Red Robin. It was around 6:30p and there was a lot of activity but we were quickly seated. Reviewing the menu, the prices seemed reasonable. My wife ordered the Bruschetta Chicken sandwich with sweet potato fries and I order the Prime Rib sandwich with regular fries. On the plus side, my wife really liked her Bruschetta Chicken sandwich but the sweet potato fries were slightly warm at best. My prime rib sandwich was hot but the fries too, were only slightly warm. The prime rib sandwich was OK. The meat was a bit tough and with each bite, I would get all meat and little else. The sandwich could have been better prepared so each bite would have meat, onions, cheese and bun. At least it was hot. We asked for new fries since these were warm and getting cold. A few minutes later we got a new round of "fresh" fries. My steak fries were hot this time around but the sweet potato fries were again just slightly warm. We mentioned it again and were offered another round of "fresh" fries but we declined. In the end, our server, very nice by the way, removed the upcharge for the sweet potato fries. All in all, an OK experience. We are in no rush to visit again but who knows, it might have been an off night.

Arg!! We use to eat here all the time but the last 3-4 times its been a nightmare. The service sucks. The food is always wrong. It takes FOREVER to get anything to drink. Just don't waste your time or money!

Poorly managed, expensive and not very good. Pre-frozen institutional food, everything just heated and served  If you sit and eat at the bar good service from Princess. The bad table service is well known by all but still it goes on since day one. They know it and they simply don't care. Expensive, so hold that thought when ya check prices.
Ok so once again AMAZING experience at Red Robin! The manager and the server were fantastic! I love their food kudos to the chefs as well! Go there and ask for Laurilee she is awesome!

I had a royal red robin double cheeseburger with a sunny side egg on top. The tropical mai tai was actually pretty good but they need to add more alcohol to it . The bottom-less fries are also very good with their special seasoning.

Overall Summary: 4.5 stars out of 5. A great chain with lots of burger options. The restaurant is kept clean and the waitstaff are polite. The good: We tried the Smoke & Pepper buger (pepper bacon on an Angus patty with ciabatta bread) and the Red Robin Gourmet Cheeseburger. They give very large portions and they have free refills on their fries (Bottomless Fries). We decided to splurge and try their Mountain High Mudd Pie that is chocolate ice cream on top of a cookies & cream (ice cream) pie. The cleanliness of the restaurant and the restrooms was great.  The negative: The service was average - our waitress seemed a little distracted. She forgot the suger for our iced teas at first and then only checked in on us once afterwards.She was still very polite and she was very prompt when bringing our food - our wait was failry short.

It's alllllll about the shroom burger. And the strawberry lemonade! So yum! Unlimited fries! Everytime we go the bartender is always cool! Their ranch is the best freaking ranch ever!!!!!! Join the rewards program and get a free burger after buying a certain number of items!
The one in Thousand Oaks is a lot slower. This one is pretty quick. Also ask for Erin, she is super nice.

Had a super fun date night with my mother in law last night. Even though they were busy we were seated and served quickly. I do wish her coffee and my soda had been refilled but other than that it was a great night in a fun environment.
Food was good...but not happy with our to-go order.  A Bleue Cheese burger should actually  HAVE bleue cheese on it.  By the time you get home, too late to get it fixed.
The Southern Charmer burger was the best I ever. The brown sugar bacon made it so great. The reason for the 4 was I asked for well done and they gave me medium well . I like to get what I ordered.

This place is the bomb. My wife and I live in Simi and have our whole lives. We have been going to Red Robin together for years, the service is usually good if you get one of the guys (especially the one that is usually in the bar). Any of the women though are terrible and never get my order right. It just makes me feel like they just don't listen or care really. But when they do get my complicated order right, it is the most amazing burger of my life.  This one is highly recommended, even on a Friday night when they are packed, you don't have to wait that long. If you join the rewards card you get a free burger every 10 meals. We go at least once a week so we get free food every month! Haha this is our favorite place to go and has amazing food. Highly recommended!

I don't always think of Red Ribbon when we go out but I'm really glad we did tonight. We had the pleasure of getting Laurilee serve our table of three. She's a pro! Great at what she does. I wish all waitstaff were like her. Thank you Laurilee! We will definitely be back.

The last 2 times I've been to this red robins I was very disappointed. The food was very mediocre and the service was even worse. The servers were not very attentive and would also very rarely clear the table of empty dishes. By the end of my meal I almost had no room for my food. And the amount of food I received was ridiculous. I ordered a burger with a side of fries and there were only maybe 10 fries on my plate and very burnt. It was a very disappointing experience.
5 stars for the good service and food. Our waiter was very attentive and generous with us. He gave us extra of their special sauce since we loved it. Will come back when I'm around this area.

Before the remodeling I would have given Red Robin 4 1/2 stars. Now, I hesitate to give it 3 stars but that's cause our waitress, Kelly, was hustling and trying so hard, due to what seems like understaffing.  They have gone from home style feeling where adults and kids are comfortable to a sterile hospital style, that makes you want to leave.  To add to it, I watched as they scrambled to set a table for a wheelchair bound man cause they don't have any handicap tables.

I am a huge fan of Red Robin. They've always had great service and delicious food. Lately, however, the service has been extremely lacking at this location!  Today, for example, I was on my lunch break and decided to treat my little sister to lunch at a restaurant of her choosing. Of course, she pick Red Robin as it's a family favs. We were seated by a nice hostess, but thereafter waited nearly 10 minutes until someone asked us for a drink order. Even the nice hostess doubled check with us because we had no drinks at our table. Our drinks came staggered; receiving the fountain drinks 5 minutes after the strawberry lemonade, and a shake much later. It would be another 10 minutes until we saw our waitress again to take our order. When she finally did take our order, she skipped around the table instead of just going in a circle (I shrugged it off as everyone has their own method of working), but then as she took the orders, she said nothing to us just stared down the next person until they realized it was their turn.  By the time the food came, I ended up having to take it to-go. The worst part about this whole experience was I had all the time in the world to count the table/employee ratio and it was a mere 2:1, which I wouldn't call busy at all.  I've worked in a restaurant in the past, so I try to be very easy on restaurant workers knowing how difficult it can be. However, unfortunately, this is not the first poor service I've received at this location. I've noticed that the long-term waiters (I'm talking about you, Laurilee!) have amazing customer service, and the crop of new people over the years seem to have little training on being friendly.  Something so easy as being friendly goes a long way!

location: Naval Air Station Point Mugu, CA
review: Our waitress princess was amazing. We had a wonderful time having lunch and just enjoying ourselves. Princess checked on us plenty of times to make sure everything was ok and she engaged in real conversation not forced at all. The whole experience was pleasant. Princess is by far the best bar tender in the restaurant.

I like the vibe and the food is great. My husband and I started going pretty frequently and Matt would typically serve up. He is great. No complaints really about service. Restaurant does get noisy but that is to be expected.

Not impressed that the cup of soup is even smaller now that they remodeled. I used to be able to order a cup of soup and a wedge salad and I would be pleasantly full but right now I feel like I can definitely eat more. The remodel looks nice though.

Lunch on the way out of town... And a simple request of an allergen menu is met with a smarmy "just download our app" response from the manager... But, we don't WANT your app - We just want lunch. Not to mention, the restaurant has absolutely terrible cell service (at least AT&T). Though, you'd figure not being not far outside the LA area, they'd not only have an allergen menu, but it'd be broken down by food group, day of the week, total calories, and phase of the moon... But apparently, everyone's so tied to the phone and an app, why do they even print menus anymore? Oh well... (FWW, I *have* been too other Red Robins that have full nutritional menus... Maybe this place has removed them to prevent people from casually browsing them, only to suddenly regret what they had ordered?) On the plus side, our server (Erin) handled things very gracefully, and was overly patient with us. Also, the manager, once he was running food, seemed pleasurable. So, a bit of a boost, there. Yes, I actually hate being a bother in restaurants... It stresses me out, and this is supposed to be an easy and pleasurable experience, right? Overall, our food was cooked to order, and really not much different than other parts of the chain. I just wish they'd have thought through the whole "customer service" aspect a bit better. My goal is simply to have a reasonable lunchbe and be as little a bother as possible.

For a decent family meal, this place is pretty good.  They are trying to go upscale somewhat with featured burgers.  Still if you don't want a burger, the Ensanada Chicken platter is one of my favorites and the fish and chips is also good.

We have visited Red Robin in the Simi Town Center on several occasions. Tonight, we brought some friends to visit and see the new renovation. We were seated but after 30 minutes never saw a waiter/waitress. I went to the hostess and asked to see the manager. I connected with manager Joey. He was awesome. He apologized and offered to get us another table and a server ready to help us. We were seated and immediately waitress Lola was at our table. She was awesome, our food was fabulous. Joey, the manger came by on a few occasions and confirmed all good and that our party was doing great. The manager and Lola, our waitress went out of their way to ensure we were well taken care of. The food, as previously stated was phenomenal as well. Our whole party was so impressed on how the manger, Joey, handled the situation. Although I am aware that issues happen, his handling of the problem was done calmly and professionally and he stayed connected throughout the evening. We will be back and so will the guests we brought for the first time. Thank you again Joey and Lola. You were both amazing tonight.

We usually love RR but yesterday our service was beyond horrible. There were 10 of us, the restraunt was not busy at all. Food took 20 min to come to the table and the majority of it was cold, we have no silverware or napkins, had to wait almost 10 more min for silverware because it was being washed. I had to ask for my salad twice after everyone had their food the server said she was going to send out the manager, but they never came out.

They've remodeled this restaurant.  It looks so much better now. I haven't been here in a while,  but was glad I came back. I was thinking my options were limited since I'm a peqstetarian.  I was wrong because they had options where you can switch a bocca in replace of the meat.  Also,  the bottomless french fries are a hit.

I called in an order to go. I asked for a turkey burger with bacon cheese wheat bun and barbecue sauce. Instead, I got a turkey patty on white bread with mayonnaise. no barbecue sauce and no bacon. I did not realize this until I had left the establishment. When I came back to get a new order, for some reason, it took 25 minutes to fix the burger. During my wait, I was not offered any water or free item or gift certificate for future use. I will never go back to this Red Robin again.

Love the re-model. Smart move since Buffalo Wild Wings just showed up this month in the same town center. I'm never disappointed with this location. It seems like a more yard house adult type area. But still family friendly of course. I would like to see this place succeed. Food is good. Bottomless fries are always on point. Their salted caramel shake for the fall is super yummy. And servers are friendly
No host at the front counter for over 6 - 8 minutes.    Servers were trying to figure out how to use the check in system.    Very unorganized.

I've been going to RR frequently and never had a problem till yesterday. It was all remodeled and nice. After we ordered apparently the price of eggs altered my cobb salad and put cucumber instead of egg. Not a word was said when I ordered. The cool bread they had was to strips of burnt garlic toast and our waiter was scatter brained. It was horrible. Other people's burgers were good giving the 2 stars, but I was not happy.

This place is a ripoff. I don't see how burgers can be $10, no matter how gourmet they are. In n Out and the Habit offer burgers just as good if not better for pretty much half the price. The appetizers are way too pricy as well. 5 zucchini sticks for $5.99...? Luckily the cocktails are not poorly priced. I've seen worse.

Great food great service-joined up their rewards program-great specials-food fresh and tasty-waitress and waiters are AMAZING!! They recommended items we might like-professional and friendly-their service is why I will be back!! (Was there late night 12/10/2015 and 12/11/2015)

Well on a Friday night you would think that this establishment would have all the ace's in place to be able to accommodate their guests,not the case on my visit friday night.First and foremost,I was put in the rear of the location by the bar area,next to the restrooms.I mean really.I don't recommend to be seated in this area at all. My server was the bartender.So just vigilize he has to make all the drinks for the entire dinning room and the bar area.So your service is not going to be good at all. As my food came out,the server just put the food down on the table and walked away,without asking if you would need anything else.I enjoy eating the fries with there ranch sauce.So I asked for another server to come over and she did. The bartender wasn't attentive at all.Service is lacking at this location.No communication what so ever from the employees. The bartender should remain in his station and the servers should assist him with his orders.Must locations that do a high volume have some type of communication device,a hand held device or radio.This location does not.From the front of the house to the rear of the house. As I was leaving I could see several dishes on the counter,waiting for someone to expedite them out.They should have a manger or a strong server to be able to do this. Its like sports,if you have a player out of position.whats going to happen?

This review is about the problem I had at Red Robin last night. I've been to Red Robin several times, the food isn't great, but it's not horrible.  Last night we went in and planned on using a gift card we received.  We were told we couldn't use it, their system for that was down. But they could do a regular credit card. Sound fishy.  I spoke to the manager Luis, he informed us that it has been down for a couple days, funny down on xmas weekend.  The manager was pleasant, but didn't do anything to help the situation

Everything here is just okay. The food is okay, the service is okay. The new kiosks are really limiting in the way that they accept coupons, split bill, promotions, rewards club, etc.  And frankly.... I don't think I should have to work that hard. I think the waitress should do that stuff for me. They also make the whole tipping thing awkward.

I've eaten at Red Robin a few times and I have never been dissapointed. The drinks are very good and their bottomless fries are spectacular. Their gourmet burgers are worth every calorie and dime. My friends and I eat here occasionally and have been aquatic acquainted with all of the friendly and helpful servers.  The animated bill is very convenient. You can easily split the bill and pay with a card. Paying with cash is traditional.  Waiters come occasionally to ask how you are doing and re fill drinks. All drinks and meals are made well.

Our first experience here was upsetting. It took forever to get our appetizers, food, drinks.  Plus our drinks weren't correct.  Won't ever go back an pay that mu check money for dissapointing food. Asked for our burger well done, it was pink!! Very dissapointed, we wanted to give it a try but I was disgusted!! $

Good burgers, awesome steak-fries and shakes.  This location is, well, average.  I've visited a few times, but only during non-peak hours; I was therefore well attended to, but the ambiance was dead.  Perhaps it's more exciting on weekend evenings?

It's just ok. I'm sad to write this because it use to be my favorite place. The food quality is just ok. The oil for the jalapeño coins tasted old. They have good deals and decent service. I think maybe the last two time we're off days.

Food is usually great. Servers can be slow at times. My grandparents go to Red Robin a lot; as long as they are treated as if they're the most important people in the world, I don't have a problem with you. I brought my pup to eat with me after his surgery (we shared the chicken sandwich and my dad gave him some burger) and the server was very polite; brought Junior a water dish right away. Junior loved the food, and it was the perfect outing for him. Dakota is the chillest here.

The server was excellent and did her job perfectly. BUT me and my partner ordered boca burgers and they had hard firm parts in the patty. Mine was okay, but my partners was mostly hard and firm. Nobody would ever eat that. So we sent it back and got a new burger to go. She ate it the next day and got sick not long after and has had food poisoning for the last 12 hours now. I'm never going to eat at any red ribbon location ever again. I'll take in'n'out and the habit any day.
The best service a person can ask for. The manager Veronica went above and beyond for us

Worst service I've had in a long time! Went here for lunch last Saturday and it was half empty. My friend and I had 4 kids between us so we asked the waitress if we could use 2 tablets at the table so the kids could play games. She informed us that we would need 2 separate orders to use 2. We said no problem and we would do 2 checks. After ordering drinks the waitress came back and said we couldn't use 2 tablets because it was busy that day and each table needed one. I kid you not, the place was at least half empty. A complete ghost town. So we asked if we could keep the extra tablet until more customers came in. The waitress informed us she had already asked the manager and the manager said absolutely not. We asked to speak to the manager and was told that the manager was in a meeting and couldn't talk to us. Of course with 4 hungry kids we couldn't up and leave so we ordered our food and stayed. The waitress brought our food and never came back again!! We ended up just paying on our tablet without ever seeing the waitress again. By the time we left on this supposedly busy day, there were only 2 other families in the restaurant. Thanks a lot Red Robin!

Just to be fair, they do not deserve my 5 Stars on this Rating; it is meant to add a star to compensate for the review where they got 2 Stars because they could not (not would not) accept a Gift Card due to the system being down. I recall being there around that time, Christmas weekend, and recall the hand written apology signs clearly posted on the front door that Gift Cards can not be accepted at this time - but I chose to eat there and pay rather than NOT eat there and ding them on Yelp!. ************************************** I regularly visit this location and the one in Woodland Hills/Canoga Park, but this review is about my experience today for lunch. I walked in around 1:30 and the host was in the process of seating a young mother and her 2 children; I watched as he accomodated their comfort by removing chairs, etc. He returned and promptly seated me at a small 2 person booth in that narrow strip between the bar section and the restaurant section. I waited a little longer than I liked to have my order taken, but in the meantime anoher server asked if anyone had helped me, took my beverage order and brought it to me. My server appeared shortly after, took my order and it was on.   My 'Shroom Burger with added bacon arrived with "some pink" (medium) just as I'd ordered it, with a large amount of mushrooms, a decent amount of crispy bacon, and a modest portion of fries.  Both condiments I'd ordered came with the burger - Blue Cheese and Spicy Ketchup(?)  The burger was tasty, and did not oversaturate the bun with juices; The fries were hot and fresh, just a little bit crispy, but not soft - (My next order of fries were crisper! Love those bottomless fries)  During my meal I'd had both servers check in on me to ask how everything was, and if I needed anything else.  My beverage was refreshed more than once, as well.  When I informed my server that I was 'ready for the check' she waited as I produced my Royalty Club card from my wallet.  3 more to go 'til a Free Burger.  I paid cash, left a tip and I was off. **************************************  As stated, my review is inflated by 1 Star.  Not this visit, but normally that Front Counter reception area has no one there (this time, yes.)  There is a terminal right next to the entry which one of the front section servers was using; facing me but not acknowledging me in the least.  Had I just come in, and not seen the host seating the mother and her 2 kids, I would have had the impression that I was being ignored. A smile and "someone wiill seat you shortly" would have gone a long way to avoid that feeling. The wait for taking my order was longer than I was comfortable with, which was lessened by help from another server bringing my beverage. Finally, while the burger was tasty and had "some pink," I did find it drier than normal, as in not as much of the juices as expected.  Guessing that the cook is pressing the meat as it is cooked - squeezing out the juices. Solid 3.5 to 4 Stars - plus 1 Star rounded up (like my tips.)

I don't come to this restaurant too often, but when I do the food is consistently good. I enjoy their special limited time burgers. Their Ramen burger is quite good, a little greasy, but tasty. They have good salads and lots of options for kids. During this visit we arrived not long after a party of 26 was seated. Our server gave us the heads up that we should get our order in soon, otherwise it would be a while before our order was up. This was greatly appreciated, especially when you dine with kids. Overall, another good meal from this restaurant.

Service was okay.... Waitress seemed overwhelmed even though she only had a few tables to wait on. Food was good but it took forever to get to us. I'd probably go back but it wouldn't be my first choice.

Always good food and good service....For a great burger and a bottomless basket of delicious fries this would be your go to restaurant.  I love the way they have jazzed up the restaurant with new decor, too! It definitely helps brighten up the front of the Simi Town Center! So nice to have one so close to home!
They improved with new menu.  Good tasty burger.  They are specialized in burger but for anything other than burger, the taste is not good.
Just ordered to pick some food up and Jessica helped me today and she was absolutely wonderful!! Not only did she greet me with a smile but she got me my food in a timely manner and was so kind!!!

Service is always great. Veggie options leave much to be desired. Their salads usually have fried tortillas covered in cheese, but hard to find protein options if you don't eat meat. But they are very considerate of our lunch hour. And we are always greeted with a smile and excellent staff, speaks to the management.
I come here with my friends often and we always get great service! Always...come you will never be disaapointed.

I ordered a Boca burger and it came pale in color not brown at all so I asked the waitress about it and she told me they microwave it. I was disgusted. I asked it they could grill it like they do every other burger or chicken patty and when it came back it was still odd looking. I ordered it before plenty of times at other Red Robins and it's been a good substitute. Not here. I decided to ordered something else and it was okay. Not really impressed anymore.

This location specifically is horrible at take out. Every single time we order, I swear, they screw up. 15 minute wait time turned into 40. Got 2 sodas free for the wait, but both sandwiches I ordered were wrong and nasty...... Again.  Never forget. Never again.

September 23, 2016 at 8:19 pm. We were seated in a booth several feet away from the bar and the two restrooms.  Ahh, the wafted plumes of an industrial chemical disinfectant work wonders with the olfactory senses and human desires of food! The good: Ordered one drink (freckled lemonade), three waters. Food: fish and chips, pretzel bites, and bbq chicken burger with lettuce wrap.  Chicken burger was excellent. The bad: "Endless" fries looked and felt like tepid rubber bands.  Who wants an endless supply of stale fish bait?  Pretzel bites were alternately warm and cold with a rubbery texture and "tooth-flossing capable" surface.  The cheese was interesting... rather mildly put... it looked melted but with a color not unlike that of the discharge from a nose-clogging sinus infection.  The texture was similar to ear wax, soft and sticky.  It was cold and unappetizing. Similar to the glacial pace of our server, the fish and chips had a few slow moments as well.  Fries lacked warmth and exuded a look of being purely artificial, as if they had been purchased from a novelty store that carries only fake food used on film sets.  We ordered another set of fries; two baskets arrived and were a bit warmer, but not fresher. The fish was cold.  The tartar sauce was warm, very warm.  I had specifically asked for the sauce to be quite cold.  It is a little after 9 pm at this moment... I will let my dear readers know of any bouts with food poisoning should it occur later this evening. The ugly: The bill came to $38.51.  I left two twenty dollar bills with no tip - eh, $1.49.  TIP is an acronym meaning "To Insure Promptness".  Tonight it was: "Thoroughly Incompetent Personnel".  The service was equally terrible: random movements of staff exhibiting molecular "Brownian Motion" as they rushed to and fro with furrowed brows and downcast eyes... now, I know you can point out correctly that the evening was Friday - I expected it to be busy...however; there were many empty tables near us... a few people waiting to enter the restaurant were outside.  Most likely, the others went home to watch the ceremonies involving Vin Scully at Dodgers Stadium. I will not eat here again... come on, Red Robin!  What happened to your impeccable service and willingness to make things right?  I told a hostess on the way out that "the food was terrible".  She shrugged her shoulders.  I was given no comment card, and no web address to advise the management/owner.  So... you will be notified in this public forum rather than a simple, albeit private, email. Conclusion: Try the pizza across the way in the next door restaurant.  The organized atmosphere there is far more conducive to permitting efficient food service with freshness as its watchword; not at Red Robin where the service emulated the confused, illogical and frenetic activity that occurs when one uses a heavy boot and stomps upon a red ant hill in the desert floor.

Worst service ever. I've been here 3 times and all 3 had horrible service with waiting way too long for food and drinks. The only reason I've come back is because other family members want to come, next time I'll do a better job of talking them out of it.

So last night the four of us go to dinner. Jessica is our waitress. One order of chicken Ensenada, three avo Cobb o salads.  All three salads, no avo. Asked Jessica, she just said, oh ya, we are out of avocados. Alright, thanks for telling us when we ordered. I mean, avocado is the first ingredient in the salad. Jessica said she would check to see if we could get some guacamole instead. She brought back two cups, ok.. Were we supposed to share? Asked for another. Ok. You can figure it out from here.

I wish Red Robin in Simi Valley would get it together. Went in for dinner last night (Tuesday) our burgers were cold, and the fries cold and soggy. We normally go to the one in Canoga Park which is always on point so I am disappointed every time we come to the Simi Valley location. Our server was great but seemed very busy and overwhelmed.

Horrible service. Waited over 10 min to get seated when there were only about 6 other people there, another 10 min to get our drinks ordered, and over 45 min for a server to take our order. There were no servers in sight. Our bottomless fries consisted of a tray with 5 fries and never saw a server to refill our trays or drinks. The two customers at tables behind us kept complaining about their food so I know we weren't the only ones having a bad experience.

Got seating pretty fast, and order taken at a decent pace but what really made us pay early and walk out was waiting for literally two cheeseburgers with fries for over an hour. Yes it was a good flow of people but come on, it doesn't take that long to make a burger. This is the second time at the Simi location where we have been disappointed.

Great food and wonderful service BUT... their fries are the worst after being reheated. I normally order a burger from some places and save half of the fries but unfortunately I won't buy another burger here again because these reheated fries are complete starch blocks.... :/

I discovered their chili. I am on a serious chili kick last few months. I have tried many chili's local and around the valley. Personally, I found theirs to be super awesome. Now it does need a huge helping of onions, and a ton of tabasco sauce to make it to my liking. The folks there already know me since I frequent the place often. I get two chili bowls. The bowls are small. what can I say. Hey, don't judge. It is my absolute most favorite thing to eat in the whole world lately. Yes, I am odd. I get my chili's and some ice tea. I am good to go. Their burgers and onion rings are good too. Never had bad service. My glass is always full, the servers are great.

Was driving and stopped for dinner here. The service was excellent, we got seated right away even though they were pretty busy. Our server, Matt, was very friendly and attentive without making us feel rushed or awkward, while still maintaining a friendly  and fun demeanor. If we over closer it would be a regular stop for us. Food was very good, held up the red Robin name well! Overall, two happy costumers!

My husband and I had finished shopping and decided to get a burger. He went to the car to drop off our packages while I went into the restaurant to get a seat. Silly me. There was no hostess in sight. I paced back and forth hoping someone would think I was lost and speak to me. But no. I waited and waited and waited and waited. Then I waited some more. My husband came in and asked me what I was doing. He obviously had never seen WAITING  before. Then, from across the room, she emerged, and noticed me, covered in cobwebs. She sprinted pasted the tables and greeted me cheerfully, as if I hadn't grown another year older waiting to meet her. Our waitress Mandy was happy and efficient. She brought our drinks right away and took our order for two burgers which took 50 MINUTES TO ARRIVE AT OUR TABLE. The place wasn't busy, empty tables everywhere. My husband looked at the burgers and said 'Why did this take 50 MINUTES?' We didn't have a clue. We were clueless. As usual. I had the Southern Charm burger, which was anything but charming. I ordered it medium rare. It was well done. Really well done, dry, small-brick-like. When Maddy asked if everything was okay I showed her the tiny brick and said it should have been medium rare. She offered to take it back and bring another but I needed to be home before Valentine's Day. I slathered it in BBQ sauce and ate half. My dog enjoyed her half but she's not as picky as me. Plus she didn't have to pay for it. Oh, did I mention the onions, or lack thereof? The picture in the menu shows mounds of grilled onions. My overcooked burger showed three little strings, which were hiding under the two tiny pieces of bacon. I had a side salad with it, bleu cheese dressing was okay, bagged salad lettuce was turning brown. We left Maddy a good tip because the lousy food and slow kitchen and disappearing hostess weren't her fault. I gave it two stars because my husband's hamburger was better than mine, though the patty was half the size of the bun. Red Robin Simi? Never again.

Two stars are given today not because of the service, food, or staff. This poor review is because they  no longer have free Wi-Fi. In fact in order to post this review I had to open up Wi-Fi courtesy of another sponsor. It seems like such a simple thing to do in order to attract more customers. Everyone living in Simi Valley understands when they go to the mall their cell phone signal suffers. Apparently, red Robin is completely unaware of this. Not a good move by management. It's very basic, serve your customers and give them what they want and need or find another line of business.

What's with their Cole Slaw?? I ordered a burger and decided to get Cole slaw instead of fries. What I got was a small bowl of shredded cabbage with nothing on it. No seasonings, no sauce, nothing. If I just wanted shredded cabbage I could have made it myself.  The burger was fine and the foods usually fairly good but you may want to skip their flavorless Cole slaw.

So pleasantly surprised by the willingness to accommodate my weird portion issue. They were ready and willing to make my meal super small and did so with a huge smile. Great service by our waitress Princess and the manager was authentic when he walks around asking how things are and thinking you for coming in.

Red Robin is always great and we got very good service. My mom and I went around 6 pm on a Wednesday night and the place was pretty packed! I wish the Simi Town Center would liven back up again because I love the location. Anyways, we got 2 tavern doubles and fries and I really can't complain because one of our burgers ended up being free since I'm part of their rewards program and I guess tonight was my 10th burger! Such a pleasant way to end our visit!

After the longest day of shopping sample sales with my 3 girls. We were in Los Angeles from 11am to 3pm. Not sure of the ares. We decided to come back home to Simi Valley and eat at our local Red Robbin. We go in and wait for a table. Weird because we never have waited in the past. We thought maybe time of day. We all ordered shakes and root beer floats. So happy to finally be sitting to eat. My girls order their regular chicken and Mac N Cheese. I order a patty melt with no onions. We recieve our food. My sandwich comes with onions on it. I simply tell the girl that dropped off my food that I ordered this sandwich without onions. She takes my plate. She brings me back my plate less than 2 minutes later. The kitchen simply scrapped off the onions. I was so angry. I asked for the manager with my plate in hand. Told her I was upset about what just happened. She wanted to know if I wanted something else. Then offered me 50% off of our bill. I however didn't eat and don't plan on coming back.

Tried to come in for dinner and a drink. Manager wouldn't accept my state issued California temporary ID along with my recently expired ID. The DMV says that these are perfectly valid when shown with each other... Manager had a bad attitude about it as well. Terrible experience. Do yourself a favor and go to Buffalo Wild Wings right next door.

5 stars for the awesome bartender. Minus 2-3 stars for the low quality food and atmosphere   We felt like we were at a Chucky Cheese!  It was so loud with the children screaming and loud music made us want to finish our quasi burgers as quick as possible and scram!  And that's just what we did!
The chef is amazing! He came out and saw us and talked to us about our burgers. Best burgers nicest staff

Red Robin used to be very satisfying. But the burger is just getting smaller and smaller. And I know the fries are bottomless, but just having few pieces and then have to go through the trouble of asking for more really lower the experience. Service is still great!

It was pretty packed tonight, probably because it was a Friday night. It took 25 minutes for them to seat our table of two. The food and service were decent. I would have appreciated it if the service was a quicker. When we would ask for drink refills it took around 10 minutes to get them. I'll come back if I have to, but if not, I would rather go somewhere with better food and service.

Felt unwelcome. The waitress didn't seem very happy to take our orders. She only asked me what I would like to drink, I asked for water. She didn't bother asking the other guests I had at the table & just rushed off. It wasn't very busy at the time, so we expected better service. At least a warm greeting! This chick was just cold with lack of personality. We decided to leave immediately. No one wants to eat at a place where you feel uncomfortable. I've been to friendlier Red Robin's & will not be returning to this one.

Food was okay. If you get "bottomless fries," they won't offer you more. But my main concern is regarding seating. They tried to seat us next to a troubled baby, so we asked to be seated away from children. With that request, they took us to the bar area, with a sign indicating age restriction.  Then they proceeded to seat two other people near us, in two close booths, and both of these people had small children.  I don't know if this is a law enforcement issue, or just policy. But if it's illegal to seat anyone under the age of 21 near the bar, then the cops might want to check this out.
I ordered soup chicken tortilla soup, the large one for $5.50, the soup was super small not worth $5.50, it didn't even  have chicken in it...

I am giving one star because I had two decent experiences here in the past. My experience yesterday warrants zero stars. I came in to pick up a to-go order. It took nearly ten minutes to locate the person who took my order. I was sent from the host stand to the back bar to a group of servers and back to the host stand, and still no one knew who could help me. I was in a hurry by the time I was able to pay for the meal so I didn't check the containers. That was a mistake. Our lettuce-wrapped burgers were just the contents of the burger thrown in a box with white and yellow stems of lettuce heads. It was a mess. Everything was water logged. I ended up eating a soggy, cold veggie patty and wet cheese with a fork since the $1.49 lettuce wraps didn't exist.  It's a shame this place can't be more consistent.

Was hesitant to try this place given the previous reviews  but we had a coupon so decided to give it a try,  I like that they have an outdoor seating area, so we can bring our fur baby here to people watch (always a plus), food was good and speedy, the service was attentive.  Would I come here again definitely would come here again

Compared to the red eye sore of past the newly decorated interior is a change for the better.  Also, the menu update offers more variety with a myriad of burger choices.  And who can complain about the endless steak fries which particularly good with just the right amount of crispiness.  Interior is good, menu is great, fries are top notch so why the mediocre rating.  At the end of the day it comes down to the quality of food and while the burgers look great on the menu the taste doesn't quite  hold up it's end of the bargain.  Seriously, if you paying upwards to $13.00 for a burger you expect some distinctness, some really enhanced flavoring or something that makes you remember that burger.  Again, interior, menu, fries heck even the service is pretty damn good.  The real issue are the burgers which is ironic because it's a burger joint.  You might be better off with three in n out burgers for a price of Red Robins.
Always good burgers and unlimited fries! Friendly staff and clean restaurant. My son loves coming here!

Service is one of the best out of all the Red Robins i have been too! There new changes on the menu is perfect!!! New options and lower cost burger for a low cost lunch is attractive.. Only jab is the little tablets on the table, parents beware before your kids go on it.  The cancel button is small and the PLAY NOW button is big with tiny letters of a charge.
